list_definition.definition: to put or place

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She set the tray down on the table.

list_definition.definition: to put plates, knives, forks etc on (a table) for a meal

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Please would you set the table for me?

list_definition.definition: to settle or arrange (a date, limit, price etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Have you set a date for the wedding yet?

list_definition.definition: to give a person (a task etc) to do

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The witch set the prince three tasks
The teacher set a test for her pupils
He should set the others a good example.

list_definition.definition: to cause to start doing something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His behaviour set people talking.

list_definition.definition: (of the sun etc) to disappear below the horizon

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It gets cooler when the sun sets.

list_definition.definition: to become firm or solid

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Has the concrete set?

list_definition.definition: to adjust (eg a clock or its alarm) so that it is ready to perform its function

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He set the alarm for 7.00 a.m.

list_definition.definition: to arrange (hair) in waves or curls.
to fix in the surface of something, eg jewels in a ring.
to put (broken bones) into the correct position for healing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They set his broken arm.

list_definition.definition: fixed or arranged previously

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There is a set procedure for doing this.

list_definition.definition: (often with on) ready, intending or determined (to do something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He is set on going.

list_definition.definition: deliberate

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He had the set intention of hurting her.

list_definition.definition: stiff; fixed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He had a set smile on his face.

list_definition.definition: not changing or developing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: set ideas.

list_definition.definition: (with with) having something set in it

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a gold ring set with diamonds.

list_definition.definition: a group of things used or belonging together

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a set of carving tools
a complete set of (the novels of) Jane Austen.

list_definition.definition: an apparatus for receiving radio or television signals

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a television/radio set.

list_definition.definition: a group of people

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the musical set.

list_definition.definition: the process of setting hair

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a shampoo and set.

list_definition.definition: scenery for a play or film

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There was a very impressive set in the final act.

list_definition.definition: a group of six or more games in tennis

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She won the first set and lost the next two.

list_ex_of_english: But this is also to be kept secret, lest he should perhaps want to set himself against this as well.
A set of players, a constant fraction of which are dishonest, are trying to elect a common leader.
Intuitively, with the pollution charge set too high, good 2 is protected less than good, 3 initially.
The predicate consistent1/2 creates a set of more involved constraints.
Computing preferred answer sets by meta-interpretation in answer set programming.
The fifth (unactuated) equation in the set (23) is a second-order nonholonomic constraint.
A second common feature of qualitative research is the emphasis upon the description of the setting being investigated.
Traditions, he concludes, are "not merely sets of ideas" (507).
